method: Calculate total charge Q = I * t. Time must be in seconds: 30.0 min * 60 = 1800 s. Q = 1.50 A * 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons n(e-) = Q / F using F from L19: 2700 / 96500 = 0.02798 mol. From the half-equation in L52 (Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu), 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of Cu. Moles of Cu = 0.02798 / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Mass of Cu = moles * Ar(Cu) using L24: 0.01399 * 63.55 = 0.889 g.
